sen.j: 橘諸兄（たちばな の もろえ、天武天皇13年（684年）- 天平勝宝9年1月6日 (旧暦)（757年1月30日））は、奈良時代の政治家・元皇族。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Moroe (684 – February 3, 757) was a politician in the Nara period, born as a member of the Imperial family.
TACHIBANA no Moroe (684 – February 3, 757) was a politician in the Nara period, born as a member of the Imperial family.
TACHIBANA no Moroe (684 – February 3, 757) was a politician in the Nara period, originated in the Imperial family.

sen.j: 敏達天皇の後裔で大宰帥美努王の子。
sen.e: He was a descendant of the Emperor Bidatsu, and a son of Minu no Okimi who worked as a Dazai-no-sotsu (director of Dazaifu [Kyushu branch government]).
He was a descendant of the Emperor Bidatsu, and a son of Minu no Okimi who worked as a Dazai-no-sotsu (director of Dazaifu [Kyushu branch government]).
He was a descendant of the Emperor Bidatsu, and a son of Minu no Okimi who worked as a Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu [local government office in Kyushu region]).
sen.cmt: 用語表現を変えました。

sen.j: 元の名前を葛城王（葛木王・かつらぎのおおきみ）。
sen.e: Moroe's original name was Katsuragi no Okimi (expressed as 葛城王 or 葛木王).
sen.cmt: 同じ読み方で2つの漢字表記が出ているので、漢字のまま訳出しています。
sen.e: Moroe's original name was Katsuragi no Okimi (expressed as 葛城王 or 葛木王).
His original name was Katsuragi no Okimi (written as 葛城王 or 葛木王 in Chinese characters).

sen.j: 正一位・左大臣。
sen.e: His final position was Shoichii Sadaijin (Senior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
His final position was Shoichii Sadaijin (Senior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
His final position was Shoichii (Senior First Rank), Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).

sen.j: 井出左大臣または西院大臣と号する。
sen.e: He was also known as Minister of the Left Ide or Saiin Daijin (Minister Saiin).
He was also known as Minister of the Left Ide or Saiin Daijin (Minister Saiin).
He called himself as Ide Sadaijin or Saiin Daijin (Minister Saiin).

sen.j: 初代橘氏長者。
sen.e: He was the first Tachibanashi choja (chieftain of the Tachibana Family).
He was the first Tachibanashi choja (chieftain of the Tachibana Family).
He was the first Tachibanashi choja (chieftain of the Tachibana clan).

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 敏達天皇の5世（もしくは4世）子孫で諸王であった。
sen.e: He was a fifth (according to other theory, fourth) generation descendant of the Emperor Bidatsu, and was a shoo (prince without imperial proclamation).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was a fifth (according to another theory, fourth) generation descendant of the Emperor Bidatsu, and was a shoo (prince without imperial proclamation).
He was a fifth (or fourth) generation descendant of the Emperor Bidatsu, and was a shoo (prince without imperial proclamation).

sen.j: 天平8年（736年）弟の佐為王と共に母・橘三千代の姓氏である橘宿禰を継ぐことを願い許可される。
sen.e: In 736, he and his younger brother Sai no Okimi asked for succeeding TACHIBANA no Sukune (Tachibana was the family name of their mother TACHIBANA no Michiyo; sukune was third highest of the eight hereditary titles), and received admission.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 736, he and his younger brother Sai no Okimi asked to succeed TACHIBANA no Sukune (Tachibana was the family name of their mother TACHIBANA no Michiyo; sukune was third highest of the eight hereditary titles), and they received admission.

In 736, he and his younger brother Sai no Okimi asked to succeed TACHIBANA no Sukune (sukune refers to the third highest of the eight hereditary titles), which was the surname of their mother TACHIBANA no Michiyo, and permitted.

sen.j: これ以後、橘諸兄と名乗る。
sen.e: After that, he used the name of TACHIBANA no Moroe.
After that, he used the name of TACHIBANA no Moroe.
After that, he called himself TACHIBANA no Moroe.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: この王の位を捨て、わざわざ朝臣より下の宿禰のカバネを授かると言う一見不可思議な行為は、藤原氏に対する処世術では無いかと推測される。
sen.e: His action of abandoning a title in the Imperial family and choosing to receive the title of Sukune, not a senior title Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles), is seemingly inscrutable, but this can be supposed as a way of getting along with the Fujiwara clan.

His action of abandoning a title in the Imperial family and choosing to receive the title of Sukune, not a senior title Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles), is seemingly inscrutable, but this can be supposed as his way of getting along with the Fujiwara clan.

His action of abandoning a title in the Imperial family and choosing to receive the title of Sukune, not a senior title Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles), is seemingly inscrutable, but this can be supposed as his way of getting along with the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）、疫病の流行によって藤原四兄弟が相次いで亡くなり、続いて舎人親王を初めとして多くの政府高官が死亡した。
sen.e: In 737, because of the plague, Fujiwara four brothers passed away one after another, followed by the death of many governmental executives, such as the Imperial Prince Toneri.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 737, because of the plague, four Fujiwara brothers passed away one after another, followed by the death of many government executives, such as the Imperial Prince Toneri.
In 737, because of the plague, four Fujiwara brothers passed away one after another, followed by the death of many government executives, such as the Imperial Prince Toneri.

sen.j: 議政官がほぼ全滅し、出仕出来る公卿は従三位左大弁諸兄と同大蔵卿鈴鹿王のみとなってしまった。
sen.e: After all, most of the Giseikan (Legislature) members died and there remained only two kugyo (the top court officials): Moroe at Jusanmi Sadaiben (Junior Third Rank, Controller of the Left) and Suzuka no Okimi at Jusanmi Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After all, most of the Giseikan (Legislature) members died and there remained only two kugyo (the top court officials): Moroe at Jusanmi Sadaiben (Junior Third Rank, Controller of the Left) and Suzuka no Okimi at Jusanmi Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).

After all, most of the Giseikan (Legislature) members died and there remained only two kugyo (the top court officials) to serve: Moroe at Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Sadaiben (Controller of the Left) and Suzuka no Okimi at Jusanmi Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury).

sen.j: そこで急遽この年の8月24日 (旧暦)に諸兄を次期大臣の資格を有する大納言に、4日後に鈴鹿王を知太政官事（太政大臣と同格で皇族であることのみが任用条件）に任命して応急的な体制を整えた。
sen.e: Therefore a temporary system was hurriedly established by appointing Moroe as a Dainagon (chief councilor of state entitled to be the next minister) on September 26, 737 and Suzuka no Okimi as a Chidaijokanji (deputy to the dajo-daijin [grand minister of state]; a post at the same rank of dajo-daijin; the only quality required is being a member of the Imperial family) on September 30 in the same year.

Therefore a temporary system was hurriedly established by appointing Moroe as a Dainagon (chief councilor of state entitled to be the next minister) on September 26, 737 and Suzuka no Okimi as a Chidaijokanji (deputy to the dajo-daijin [grand minister of state]; a post at the same rank of dajo-daijin; the only quality required is being a member of the Imperial family) on September 30 in the same year.

Therefore a temporary system was hurriedly established by appointing Moroe as a Dainagon (chief councilor of state) which entitled to be the next minister on September 26 of this year and four days later, Suzuka no Okimi as a Chidaijokanji (deputy to the dajo-daijin [grand minister of state], a post at the same rank of dajo-daijin; the only quality required was being a member of the Imperial family).

sen.j: 翌10年（738年）1月13日 (旧暦)に、諸兄は正三位右大臣に任命されて一躍朝廷の中心的地位に出世する事になった。
sen.e: On February 10, 738, Moroe was appointed as Shosanmi Udaijin (Senior Third Rank, Minister of the Right), which was a promotion pushing him into the main character in the Imperial Court.
On February 10, 738, Moroe was appointed as Shosanmi Udaijin (Senior Third Rank, Minister of the Right), which was a promotion pushing him into the main character in the Imperial Court.

On February 10, 738, the following year, Moroe was appointed as Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), Udaijin (Minister of the Right), which was a promotion pushing him into the main character in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: これ以降の国政は、事実上橘諸兄が担当し、聖武天皇を補佐する事になる。
sen.e: After that, Moroe virtually took charge of the national administration and supported the Emperor Shomu.
After that, Moroe virtually took charge of the national administration and supported the Emperor Shomu.
After that, TACHIBANA no Moroe virtually took charge of the national administration and supported the Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 天平15年（743年）5月5日 (旧暦)には従一位左大臣になっている。
sen.e: On June 5, 743, he was appointed as Juichii Sadaijin (Junior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
On June 5, 743, he was appointed as Juichii Sadaijin (Junior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
On June 5, 743, he was appointed as Juichii (Junior First Rank), Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).

sen.j: 天平感宝元年（749年）には正一位に陞階。
sen.e: In 749, his rank rose to Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
In 749, his rank rose to Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
In 749, his rank rose to Shoichii.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 生前に正一位に叙された人物は日本史上でも6人と数少ない。
sen.e: Throughout all Japanese history, there are only six people who received the rank of Shoichii during their lifetime.
Throughout all Japanese history, there are only six people who received the rank of Shoichii during their lifetime.
Throughout all Japanese history, there are only six people who received the rank of Shoichii during their lifetime.

sen.j: 孝謙天皇の時代にはいると藤原仲麻呂（恵美押勝）の発言力が増した。
sen.e: In the era of the Empress Koken, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also known as EMI no Oshikatsu) had a growing influence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；原文の最初の恵美押勝はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると「藤原仲麻呂」となっているので、これで訳出しています。（括弧内の恵美押勝はこのままで正しい）
sen.e: In the era of the Empress Koken, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also known as EMI no Oshikatsu) had a growing influence.
In the era of the Empress Koken, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also known as EMI no Oshikatsu) had a growing influence.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「恵美押勝（恵美押勝）」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「藤原仲麻呂（恵美押勝）」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。

sen.j: 天平勝宝7年（755年）聖武上皇の病気に際して酒の席で不敬の言があったと讒言された。
sen.e: He slandered Moroe for using profane languages at a drinking party, concerning the sickness of the Retired Emperor Shomu, in 755.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He slandered Moroe for using profane language at a drinking party, concerning the sickness of the Retired Emperor Shomu, in 755.
He slandered Moroe for using profane language at a drinking party, concerning the sickness of the Retired Emperor Shomu, in 755.

sen.j: 同8年（756年）2月2日 (旧暦)辞職を申し出て、以後隠居した。
sen.e: Moroe resigned his post on March 11, 756, and retired.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moroe resigned his post on March 11, 756, and retired.
Moroe resigned his post on March 11, 756, and retired.

sen.j: 同9年（757年）1月6日 (旧暦)に亡くなった。
sen.e: He passed away on February 3, 757.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He passed away on February 3, 757.
He passed away on February 3, 757.

sen.j: 橘諸兄の死後、同年に息子・奈良麻呂は謀反（橘奈良麻呂の乱）を起こし獄死している。
sen.e: During the year of the death of TACHIBANA no Moroe, his son Naramaro committed the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, and died in prison.
During the year of the death of TACHIBANA no Moroe, his son Naramaro committed the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, and died in prison.
After TACHIBANA no Moroe passed away, his son Naramaro committed a rebellion (TACHIBANA no Naramaro War) in the same year, and died in prison.

sen.j: 大伴家持と親交があり、『万葉集』の撰者の一人といわれている。
sen.e: Moroe had a close association with OTOMO no Yakamochi, and is supposed to be one of the selectors of the poems in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
Moroe had a close association with OTOMO no Yakamochi, and is supposed to be one of the selectors of the poems in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
Moroe had a close association with OTOMO no Yakamochi, and is supposed to be one of the selectors of the poems in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).

sen.j: これは、『栄華物語』月の宴の巻に、「むかし高野の女帝の御代、天平勝宝5年には左大臣橘卿諸兄諸卿大夫等集りて万葉集をえらび給」とあり、これが元暦校本の裏書に、またある種の古写本の奥書にもはいったことが、一定の信憑性をもつものである。
sen.e: A certain level of reliability of the supposition is ensured by the facts that there is a description in "Eiga monogatari" (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes), Volume of Tsuki no Utage (party of the moon), saying that in 753, TACHIBANA no Moroe the Sadaijin and others selected Manyoshu poems in the era of the Empress of Koya; and that this description was included in the book-end notes of Genryaku Kohon (Genryaku Collated Text) and in the postscript of a certain old manuscript.

A certain level of reliability of the supposition is ensured by the fact that there is a description in "Eiga monogatari" (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes), Volume of Tsuki no Utage (party of the moon), saying that in 753, TACHIBANA no Moroe the Sadaijin and others selected Manyoshu poems in the era of the Empress of Koya; and that this description was included in the book-end notes of Genryaku Kohon (Genryaku Collated Text) and in the postscript of a certain old manuscript.

A certain level of reliability of the supposition is ensured by the fact that there is a description in "Eiga monogatari" (A Tale of Flowering Fortunes), Volume of Tsuki no Utage (party of the moon), saying 'in 753, TACHIBANA no Moroe the Sadaijin and others gathered to select Manyoshu poems in the era of the Empress of Koya' and that this description was included in the book-end notes of Genryaku Kohon (Genryaku Collated Text) and in the postscript of a certain old manuscript.

sen.j: のちに、仙覚は橘、大伴家持の2人共撰説を唱えるにいたった。
sen.e: Later Sengaku concluded that Manyoshu poems were selected by the two: TACHIBANA no Monoe and OTOMO no Yakamochi.
Later Sengaku concluded that Manyoshu poems were selected by the two: TACHIBANA no Monoe and OTOMO no Yakamochi.
Later Sengaku concluded that Manyoshu poems were selected by the two: TACHIBANA no Moroe and OTOMO no Yakamochi.

sen.j: 『万葉集』に7首の歌を残している。
sen.e: Seven poems by Moroe are included in the "Manyoshu."
Seven poems by Moroe are included in the "Manyoshu."
Seven poems by Moroe are included in the "Manyoshu."

sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除し、年表表示にしました。

sen.j: 757年（天平宝字元年）1月6日 (旧暦) 卒 (74)

sen.cmt: 原文には 「756年」とありましたが、ウェブで確認すると用語が「757年」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
